channel.title: [TUT] const
channel.description:
[center][img]http://img292.imageshack.us/img292/3549/newguy45ib9.png[/img][/center]
[center][b][u][size=30pt]Newguy45's const Tutorial[/size][/u][/b][/center]
[center][glow=red,2,300]For this tutorial ill be referring to my scar script "Gaiaonline Fisher Revamped" so if you dont have it get it.[/glow][/center]
[center]To start off what is a const? Well a const is more are less a choice. In my script [glow=blue,2,300]"Gaiaonline Fisher Revamped"[/glow] I use a const to let the user make the decision of what rod they want to fish with.[/center] [hr]
[center][size=30pt]How to declare a const[/size][/center]
Ok. i know what most of you are thinking you think "oh man this is easy ill i have to do is:
[code] var varname:const; [/code]
Right?"
wrong. A const is not really a variable therefore cannot be declared under Var.
so now "your wondering how am I going to do this then?"
well its simple. If you would take my script [glow=blue,2,300]"Gaiaonline Fisher Revamped"[/glow] for example you would see:
[img]http://tinypic.com/264rjgg.jpg[/img]
Notice how its not declared as a var the const has its own "void" when you declare a const it goes befor the begin line, just like var. after the word "const" you put in your choice to be made such as:
[code] weather='?'; [/code]
being who i am i like to comment the choices that are avalible to the script users such as:
[code] weather='?'; // sunny or night or rainy [/code]
telling them that they can edit that line either to:
[code] weather='sunny'; [/code]
or
[code] weather='rainy'; [/code]
or
[code] weather='night'; [/code]
once there declaired give yourself a pat on the back and continue on... [hr]
[center][size=30pt]How to set up your const choices[/size][/center]
Ok now that we have declared are const we have to create the choices in a procedure or the computer will get mad at us = O.
once again we will take a peek at [glow=blue,2,300]"Gaiaonline Fisher Revamped"[/glow] to see how i set up my const.
[img]http://i6.tinypic.com/264rtav.jpg[/img]
Now after takeing a long hard look at that const what did you notice? Every choice has a begin and end. Keep in mind if you have two begins in one of your choices you will have to end it a extra time at the end of the procedure just be careful and count your begins and ends.
now a const can vary with looks so im going to try to simulate a basic const that will write a line for the different weathers.
[code] procedure weatherchoices; begin if(weather='sunny')then begin writeln('Its sunny outside!'); end; if(weather='rainy')then begin writeln('its raining outside'); end; if(weather='night')then begin writeln('Its dark outside); end; end; [/code]
and that concludes my const tutorial keep an eye out because i may be adding more to it if people just cant seem to understand. Thanks for reading and please post your errors and until then happy scripting.

item.title: [TUT] const
item.dc:creator: @Janilabo Janilabo
item.description:
@Janilabo wrote:

Well, for sure there are people who don’t know how to use consts. …and this is very helpful tutorial for them. It’s great that you made it, newguy. Very easy to learn with that.

It’s like; consts for dummies…

Oh and, you posted this to wrong section… Should be in SCAR Scripting Help. But ey, pretty sure it will get moved really soon… (To tutorial section)

Read full topic

item.title: [TUT] const
item.dc:creator: @newguy45 newguy45
item.description:
@newguy45 wrote:

[center][/center]

[center][size=30pt]Newguy45’s const Tutorial[/size][/center]

[center][glow=red,2,300]For this tutorial ill be referring to my scar script “Gaiaonline Fisher Revamped” so if you dont have it get it.[/glow][/center]

[center]To start off what is a const? Well a const is more are less a choice. In my script [glow=blue,2,300]“Gaiaonline Fisher Revamped”[/glow] I use a const to let the user make the decision of what rod they want to fish with.[/center]
[hr]

[center][size=30pt]How to declare a const[/size][/center]

Ok. i know what most of you are thinking you think "oh man this is easy ill i have to do is:

var
varname:const;

Right?"

wrong. A const is not really a variable therefore cannot be declared under Var.

so now “your wondering how am I going to do this then?”

well its simple. If you would take my script [glow=blue,2,300]“Gaiaonline Fisher Revamped”[/glow] for example
you would see:

Notice how its not declared as a var the const has its own “void”
when you declare a const it goes befor the begin line, just like var.
after the word “const” you put in your choice to be made such as:

weather='?';

being who i am i like to comment the choices that are avalible to the script users
such as:

weather='?'; // sunny or night or rainy

telling them that they can edit that line either to:

weather='sunny';

or

weather='rainy';

or

weather='night';

once there declaired give yourself a pat on the back and continue on…
[hr]

[center][size=30pt]How to set up your const choices[/size][/center]

Ok now that we have declared are const we have to create the choices in a procedure or the computer will get mad at us = O.

once again we will take a peek at [glow=blue,2,300]“Gaiaonline Fisher Revamped”[/glow] to see how i set up my const.

Now after takeing a long hard look at that const what did you notice?
Every choice has a begin and end. Keep in mind if you have two begins in one of your choices you will have to end it a extra time at the end of the procedure just be careful and count your begins and ends.

now a const can vary with looks so im going to try to simulate a basic const that will write a line for the different weathers.

procedure weatherchoices;
begin
if(weather='sunny')then
begin
writeln('Its sunny outside!');
end;
if(weather='rainy')then
begin
writeln('its raining outside');
end;
if(weather='night')then
begin
writeln('Its dark outside);
end;
end;

and that concludes my const tutorial keep an eye out because i may be adding more to it if people just cant seem to understand.
Thanks for reading and please post your errors and until then happy scripting.

Read full topic
